means: 助动词  [非标准用语、方言] =have [主用于虚拟语气]

sentence.Network_en: No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

sentence.Network_en: Generosity is its own form of power.
Instead of complaining about what's wrong, be grateful for what's right.
sentence.Network_cn: 别抱怨不好的事，要对好的事心存感恩。

lj.lj_ly: this work is of great interest and value.
lj.lj_ls: 这项工作很重要也很有价值。

jx.jx_en_mean: denoting the least likely or expected example
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［表示最不可能或最料不到的事例］在所有…中（编编，就连，居然）

lj.lj_ly: Jordan, of all people, committed a flagrant foul.
lj.lj_ls: 就连乔丹也有过一次明目张胆的犯规。

phrase.cizu_name: of all the nerve(或英 cheek)
of an evening (或 morning etc.) informal 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: at some time in the evenings (or mornings etc.)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 晚间（或早晨）的某个时候

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch af and German ab, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin ab and Greek apo

encyclopedia.content: of [ɔv, əv, v, f] prep. 关于；属于；…的；由…组成的短语 out of 由于；离开；在…外；在……外 regardless of 不顾；不管；不惜；无论 Of course 当然；自然；当然可以；自是 approve of 满意；赞成；赞赏；获准 glimpse of 瞥见；一瞥 hear of 听说；听到；知道；耳闻 capable of 敢于；能；能够；有…能力的 inclusive of 把…包括在内；把……包括在内；包括的 critical of 挑剔；对…苛求的；对…持批

entry.tran: （用于连接两个名词，其中前者表示后者的特定方面）
entry.def: You use of to combine two nouns when the first noun identifies the feature of the second noun that you want to talk about.

example.ex: The average age of the women interviewed was only 21.5.
example.tran: 参加面试的女性平均年龄才21.5岁。

example.ex: ...the population of this town...
example.tran: 该镇的人口

entry.tran: （用于连接两个名词或名词与现在分词，其中后者对前者进行界定或补充信息）
entry.def: You use of to combine two nouns, or a noun and a present participle, when the second noun or present participle defines or gives more information about the first noun.

example.ex: Would you say what you felt was a feeling of betrayal?...
example.tran: 你是否觉得有一种被人出卖的感觉？

example.ex: She let out a little cry of pain.
example.tran: 她疼得轻呼了一声。

entry.tran: （用于指称动作的名词后说明该动作的对象或主体）
entry.def: You use of after nouns referring to actions to specify the person or thing that is affected by the action or that performs the action. For example, 'the kidnapping of the child' refers to an action affecting a child; 'the arrival of the next train' refers to an action performed by a train.

example.ex: ...the reduction of trade union power inside the party.
example.tran: 党内工会权力的削弱

example.ex: ...the assessment of future senior managers.
example.tran: 对未来高级经理的评估

entry.tran: （用于指称数量或组群的词和短语后表示计量的对象）
entry.def: You use of after words and phrases referring to quantities or groups of things to indicate the substance or thing that is being measured.

example.ex: ...7.6 litres of pure alcohol.
example.tran: 7.6升纯酒精

example.ex: ...a few kilometres of new roads.
example.tran: 几公里新修道路

entry.tran: （用于人或事物的名称后引出其所属或相关的机构或地方）
entry.def: You use of after the name of someone or something to introduce the institution or place they belong to or are connected with.

example.ex: ...the Prince of Wales.
example.tran: 威尔士亲王

example.ex: ...the Finance Minister of Bangladesh.
example.tran: 孟加拉国财政部长

entry.tran: （用于指称容器的名词后，说明容器及其所含物）
entry.def: You use of after a noun referring to a container to form an expression referring to the container and its contents.

example.ex: We could all do with a cup of tea...
example.tran: 要是能给我们都来杯茶就好了。

example.ex: Conder opened another bottle of wine...
example.tran: 康德又开了一瓶酒。

entry.tran: （用在可数名词后、不可数名词前表示某一单个物品）
entry.def: You use of after a count noun and before an uncount noun when you want to talk about an individual piece or item.

example.ex: ...a blade of grass...
example.tran: 一片草叶

example.ex: Marina ate only one slice of bread...
example.tran: 玛丽娜只吃了一片面包。

entry.tran: （表示材料或成分）由…制成（或组成）的
entry.def: You use of to indicate the materials or things that form something.

example.ex: ...local decorations of wood and straw.
example.tran: 用木头和稻草制成的本地饰品

example.ex: ...loose-fitting garments of linen.
example.tran: 宽松的亚麻布衣服

entry.tran: （用于名词后表示其为某事物的一部分）
entry.def: You use of after a noun which specifies a particular part of something, to introduce the thing that it is a part of.

example.ex: ...the other side of the square...
example.tran: 广场另一侧

example.ex: We had almost reached the end of the street.
example.tran: 我们几乎到了街的尽头。

entry.tran: （用于某些动词后表示动作所涉及的人或事物）关于，由于
entry.def: You use of after some verbs to indicate someone or something else involved in the action.

example.ex: He'd been dreaming of her...
example.tran: 他一直梦见她。

example.ex: Listen, I shall be thinking of you always...
example.tran: 听着，我会永远记得你的。

entry.tran: （用于某些形容词后表示与情感或特性相关的事物）对，为
entry.def: You use of after some adjectives to indicate the thing that a feeling or quality relates to.

example.ex: I have grown very fond of Alec...
example.tran: 我越来越喜欢亚力克。

example.ex: His father was quite naturally very proud of him...
example.tran: 他父亲自然为他感到无比骄傲。

entry.tran: （用于指称施动者的单词前说明对该动作的看法）出自…，在…一方
entry.def: You use of before a word referring to the person who performed an action when saying what you think about the action.

example.ex: This has been so nice, so terribly kind of you...
example.tran: 您这么做真是太好心，太令我们感激不尽了。

example.ex: I suppose it's stupid of us not to be able to make up our own minds...
example.tran: 我们自己都没办法拿定主意，这真是太傻了。

entry.tran: （用于描述名词后引出所指的人或事物）
entry.def: You use of after a noun which describes someone or something, to introduce the person or thing you are talking about.

example.ex: ...an awkward, slow-moving giant of a man.
example.tran: 举止笨拙、行动迟缓的巨人般的男子

entry.tran: （表示程度）更大/较小程度上的…
entry.def: If something is more of or less of a particular thing, it is that thing to a greater or smaller degree.

example.ex: Your extra fat may be more of a health risk than you realize...
example.tran: 多余的脂肪对健康的威胁可能比你意识到的要大。

example.ex: As time goes by, sleeping becomes less of a problem.
example.tran: 随着时间的推移，睡眠逐渐不再成为问题。

entry.tran: （表示某人或某事物具有的特点或特性）
entry.def: You use of to indicate a characteristic or quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: ...the worth of their music.
example.tran: 他们音乐的价值

example.ex: ...the creaminess of her skin...
example.tran: 她皮肤的光滑细腻

entry.tran: （用于be动词后表示某人或某事物具有的特点或特性）
entry.def: You use of after the verb 'be' to indicate a characteristic or quality that someone or something has.

example.ex: The crisis faced over the next few months is of an entirely different scale...
example.tran: 接下来几个月内将要面临的危机规模将是无法相比的。

example.ex: Both world wars were of unquestionable importance as economic events.
example.tran: 两次世界大战都是重要性无可置疑的经济事件。

entry.def: You use of to specify an amount, value, or age.

example.ex: Last Thursday, Nick announced record revenues of $3.4 billion...
example.tran: 上个星期四，尼克宣布公司收入创下34亿美元的纪录。

example.ex: He has been sentenced to a total of 21 years in prison since 1973...
example.tran: 自1973年以来，他已总共被判21年监禁。

entry.tran: （用于年、月等名词后表示状态或活动的持续时间）
entry.def: You use of after a noun such as 'month' or 'year' to indicate the length of time that some state or activity continues.

example.ex: ...eight bruising years of war...
example.tran: 艰苦卓绝的8年战争

example.ex: The project has gone through nearly a dozen years of planning.
example.tran: 该项目已历经近12年的规划。

entry.tran: （表示时间离某一钟点差几分）在…之前
entry.def: You can use of to say what time it is by indicating how many minutes there are before the hour mentioned.

example.ex: At about a quarter of eight in the evening Joe Urber calls...
example.tran: 大约晚上8点差一刻的时候，乔·乌尔贝尔打来电话。

example.ex: We got to the beach at five of one in the afternoon.
example.tran: 我们下午1点差5分的时候到达海滩。

slang.tokens: make little ones out of big ones

list.explanation: [黑社会用语]在狱中服刑(原指在狱中服劳役，将大石块砸成小石块)

example.en: He got made little ones out of big ones for two years.
example.zh: 他坐了两年牢。

list.explanation: 非常难应付的、不好对付的人(或事)

example.en: What a bitch of a day!
example.zh: 多么难熬的一天!

example.en: This is a bitch of a job.
example.zh: 这是件很不好办的事。

example.en: He is really a bitch of a boss.
example.zh: 他真是个难侍候的老板。

list.explanation: 从(某事物中)挣脱出来，摆脱(某事物)

example.en: Don't try to squirrel out of it. Go through with it.
example.zh: 这事你别想摆脱得了。把它进行到底吧。

list.explanation: 惹祸

example.en: It was I who opened a can of beans.
example.zh: 是我惹的祸。

example.en: She was one of those people who like opening a can of beans.
example.zh: 她就是那种喜欢惹祸的人。

list.explanation: (卡车司机用语)一卡车沙糖
(卡车司机用语)急刹车

example.en: The trucker grabbed a handful of air suddenly on the cross street.
example.zh: 卡车司机突然在十字路u口来了个急刹车。

list.explanation: (指某人丧命、遭灾或某事溃败、解体的直接原因)致命伤，祸根

example.en: Your attitude was the kiss of death for your employment here.
example.zh: 你的态度对于你在这儿的工作而言致命的弱点。

list.explanation: 非常生气的，十分烦恼的

example.en: Man, there is no reason to get so bent out of shape. I didn't mean any harm.
example.zh: 老兄,你没有理由要发这么大的火。我没有任何恶意。

example.en: I got bent out of shape because of maltreatment I received.
example.zh: 我因为受到了虐待而感到很气愤。

list.explanation: (吸毒)被麻醉的，喝醉的

example.en: I was so bent out of shape I thought I'd never recover.
example.zh: 兴时我喝得烂醉如泥，以为自己永远也醍不过来了。

list.explanation: (便餐柜台用语) 一客吐司

example.en: Has the waitress brought you an order of down?
example.zh: 女服务员已经给你送来一客吐司了吗？

slang.tokens: get ones nose out of joint

list.explanation: 小看、轻视(别人干的事)，生气，见怪

example.en: You get your nose out of joint too easily about stuff like that.
example.zh: 你太轻易地小看那样的事儿了。

example.en: Now, don't get your nose out of joint.She didn't mean it.
example.zh: 嗳，你别见怪。 她不是故意的。

list.explanation: 不中用的人，无足轻重的人，窝囊废

example.en: Who is that crock of shit who brought in the dead eat?
example.zh: 是哪个窝囊废把这中看不中用的东西弄进来的？

list.explanation: 一派胡言，屁话，虚伪的言论，拆烂污的事

example.en: You went on vacation and left this office with a real crock of shit.
example.zh: 你去度假了，把一大堆拆烂污的事留在了办公室。

list.explanation: 不在某人管辖之内的

example.en: The matter's fortunately out of my league.
example.zh: 幸亏这件事不归我管。

list.explanation: 与某人不属同一类型的

example.en: He was so sophisticated，just someone way out of her league.
example.zh: 他是那么老于世故，跟她完全是两路人。

list.explanation: (表示强调、惊讶、不耐烦、怀疑、沮丧等的感叹语)

example.en: I already did it,for the love of Pete!
example.zh: 嘿，瞧我已经干完了!

list.explanation: (对人或物表示满意或赞美)不错，相当好(尤指漂亮或吸引人的女性)

example.en: A: " What's she like?" B: "The girl? Bit of all right，from her pictures
example.zh: 甲:"她长得怎么样？" 乙:"那姑娘？从照片上看真不错。"

list.explanation: 不能取胜的或成功的，淘汰的

example.en: The Hawks are out of it this season.
example.zh: 近来鹰派人失势了。

example.en: If our team loses two more games, we'll be out of it.
example.zh: 要是我们队再输两场，那我们就会被淘汰。

list.explanation: 不合潮流的，背时的

example.en: He's a nice guy, but he's out of it.
example.zh: 他人是个好人，可惜不合潮流。

example.en: Fred is out of it most of the time. He even looks dull.
example.zh: 弗雷德常常不合潮流，他甚至看上去都木讷迟钝。

list.explanation: (吸毒迷醉而)神志恍惚的，酒醉的

example.en: I had been so out of it, I hadn't heard her question.
example.zh: 那时候我神忐恍惚，根本没有听见她的问话。

list.explanation: 使出丑，要弄，愚弄

example.en: I suddenly realized that I had been made a monkey out of by my opponents.
example.zh: 我突然意识到我被我的那些对手给耍了。

list.explanation: 胡说八道，谎言和吹牛
不值一文的事物或人，破烂货，拙劣的农演、表现，次品

example.en: The whole project's a pile of shil.
example.zh: 整个计划一无可取之处。

list.explanation: 女朋友

example.en: Me and my piece of homework want to rent a couple of horses.
example.zh: 我和我的女朋友想租两匹马。

list.explanation: 祝运气好!祝成功!

example.en: Lots of luck in your new job!
example.zh: 祝你的新工作成功!

list.explanation: [讽刺语]祝成功或好运(意味着你没希望的反语)

example.en: Think you stand a chance? Lots of luck!
example.zh: 你以为你有希望吗？祝你好运!

auth_sentence.content: Lots of people will be shocked by the result.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lots of people will be shocked by the result.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lots of people will be shocked by the result.

auth_sentence.content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content: Find out more about our use of this data.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Find out more about our use of this data.

auth_sentence.content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Let's hope for a fantastic week of tennis!

abbreviation.mean_cn: 法定的,依据药典(配制)的
任意型，任意选择的方式

means.word_mean: (表示时间)在…的, 在…之前; 在…期间

sentences.en: He was born at the turn of the century.
What do you do of a Saturday?
She did it of her own will.
He felt quite certain of success.

means.word_mean: (表示原因)由于, 因为, （用于某些形容词后，后接与感情相关的人或事）

sentences.en: I was sick of their fun and games.
New York is east of Washington.
Tom is the eldest of the family.
sentences.cn: 汤姆是家里年龄最大的。

sentences.en: The place is easy of access.
This is a house of prayer.
They were destitute of necessaries of life.

means.word_mean: 助动词.  [非标准用语、方言] =have [主用于虚拟语气]

jushi.english: This is a house of prayer.
Much of what you say is true.
It was careless of us to forget to lock the door.
jushi.chinese: 我们真粗心,竟忘了锁门。
